speaker: A
text: Markets are brutal today. Give me something motivational.

speaker: B
text: Alright, here’s one: did you know one of the richest guys in the world once lost everything over a bet?

speaker: B
text: Some old-money heir in Europe—let’s call him Jean-Pierre. One night, at a high-stakes poker game, he bet everything on a single hand.

speaker: B
text: Lost his entire inheritance in five minutes. But instead of crying about it, he walked out, started fresh, and built an empire in five years.

speaker: B
text: Oh, he just married a billionaire’s daughter. Turns out, sometimes the best recovery strategy isn’t about skill—it’s about knowing when to hedge your bets.

speaker: A
text: That’s not a lesson I can use?

speaker: B
text: Sure it is. Diversify. Or marry rich. Either works.
